items.title: New York City Will Finally Turn a Hotel Into Housing
items.abstract: Developers announced a plan to transform a Hilton hotel near Kennedy International Airport into affordable housing — the first conversion to take place through a pandemic-era state program.

items.title: Half of N.Y.C. Households Can’t Afford to Live Here, Report Finds
items.abstract: The study is the latest piece of evidence to demonstrate the depth of New York City’s affordability crisis, which is reshaping local demographics and culture.
keywords: Fund for the City of New York
United Way of New York City

items.title: Rent for Millions of New Yorkers Could Increase by 2 to 5 Percent
items.abstract: The panel, known as the Rent Guidelines Board, took a preliminary vote on potential rent hikes on Tuesday evening.

items.title: 6 Cities on 5 Continents That Are Reimagining Urban Life
items.abstract: What we can learn from creative city initiatives, from Sydney to Paris.

items.title: ‘The Era of Urban Supremacy Is Over’
items.abstract: Many of the nation’s major cities face a daunting future.
